nodes.name: Run an Actor and get dataset

options.systemMessage:
=# Overview

You are an expert technical recruiter specializing in {{ $('Loop Over Items').item.json.title }} roles.
You have been given a job description and a candidate resume. Your task is to analyze the resume in relation to the job description and provide a detailed screening report to the candidate to help in understand why he matches the job or not.

Focus specifically on how well the candidate matches the core requirements and ideal profile outlined in the job description. Evaluate both technical skill alignment and business-content understanding. Use reasoning grounded in the actual content of the resume and job post -- avoid making assumptions.

You should only write in english throughout the entire process.

## Output

Your output should follow this exact format:

**Requirements**
List the 4 most important requirements (experience level, knowledge, business, etc.) mentionned in the job offer description.

**Required Skills**
List the technical and business skills required given the job description.

**Candidate Matched Skills**
List the technical and business required skills that matches his skills from his resume and the stack from his filters as follows : {{ $('Get User Resume').item.json.filters.stack }}.

**Candidate Strengths:**
List the top strenghts or relevant qualifications the candidate brings to the table. Be specific.

**Candidate Weaknesses:**
List areas where the candidate is lacking or mismatched based on the job description.

**Overall Fit Rating (0-100):**
Assign a percentage number between 0 (terrible match) and 100 (perfect match). Do not give decimals.

**Justification for Rating:**
Explain clearly to the candidate why they received that score. Reference specific resume content and how it aligns or doesn't aligns with the job description. Keep it between 4 and 5 short phrases maximum.

## Job Description

{{ $json.job_offer }}

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Data Analyst PI Apprentice
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
LIVE THE MUSIC WITH US

From a pioneer tech start-up created in 2007, Deezer has become one of the first French unicorns and the second largest independent music streaming platform in the world.

At eighteen years old, we‚Äôre only just coming of age. Now listed on #EuroNext, Deezer is a rapidly-growing, cutting-edge player in the music streaming market. If you want an environment where you can make your voice heard and be at the forefront of music and tech, look no further!

We believe music is all about embracing the things that make us different.

Deezer is a vibrant community that celebrates uniqueness, diversity and individuality, and thrives on collaboration.

Our international and passionate teams pride themselves on being at the forefront of the music experience, going beyond streaming and helping the world to Live the Music. We‚Äôre constantly evolving alongside our customers, partners, artists and employees ‚Äî striving to make Deezer the most personal and innovative streaming service in the world.

Ready for an electrifying journey? Apply now and do your part in bringing extraordinary music experiences to people‚Äôs lives!

**Join Us**

Job Description

Starting in January 2026

Partnerships are at the heart of our DNA and are one of the main drivers of our growth: today we are partnering with leading brands like Sonos, Orange, Google Home, T-Mobile, Fnac or Amazon Alexa..

The Partnership Analyst Apprentice is part of the B2B Data squad in charge of monitoring deals‚Äô performance, provide insights to XFN teams, contribute to product & partnership strategy, design and manage tracking plan, deliver dashboards and tools, investigate data discrepancies and act as the main point of contact for partners to discuss KPI

What you will do:

  • Providing data visualisation and reports to PI teams and Partners
  • Helping building product strategy and improvements through data analysis
  • Collaborating with various teams such as Product and Tech, Commercial, Finance and Data
  • Translating data into partner value and business recommendations
  • Helping creating data processes and strategy for the PI team

Qualifications

This role is excellent for a person with:

  • Business/Engineering school candidates seeking for apprenticeship
  • Experience in SQL and curious to learn (you will be tested during the interview process).
  • Experience in Data Visualization (e.g., Tableau, Looker)
  • Capable of tackling complex problems through insightful analysis, at the intersection of technology, product, and business.
  • Possesses a rigorous, structured approach with keen attention to detail.
  • Demonstrates a genuine interest in the music/tech industry! :)

At Deezer, diversity drives innovation. Whatever makes you uniquely you, your experiences, your way of thinking, your journey, might be exactly what we need.

If this role speaks to you and aligns with your interests and capabilities, even if you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the qualifications listed, please give it a try and tell us more! #BeYou

Additional Information

At Deezer, you can be your true self as we believe that #everyvoicematters. We strive to build an inclusive culture and foster a diverse environment. Because we care and want to ensure each employee feels welcome and safe at work, we continuously focus on fighting biases and helping diverse teams work well together through multiple learning opportunities, e-learnings and workshops right from the onboarding :

  • Regular Diversity & Inclusion internal and external talks
  • Dedicated employee work streams on Gender equity, Ethnicity & Culture, Disability and LGBTQ+
  • Multiple e-learnings and mandatory training sessions for all managers
  • English and French courses for all, so that everyone can connect and feel included

Beyond benefits like health insurance and transportation, we offer you extra perks like:

  • A Deezer premium family account for free
  • Access to gym classes
  • Join over 70 Deezer Communities to connect beyond your day-to-day work, share passions, learn from each other and #Belong
  • Deezer parties several times a year and drinks every thursday
  • Allowance for sports, travelling and culture
  • Meal vouchers
  • Mental health and well-being support from Moka.Care
  • Great offices always located in dynamic and attractive districts, whether in Paris, London or Sao Paulo!
  • Hybrid remote work policy

If you want to learn more about life and culture at Deezer, please visit our Welcome to the Jungle page here!

Run an Actor and get dataset.industries: Software Development and IT Services and IT Consulting
Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
Deezer is one of the world‚Äôs largest independent music experiences platforms, connecting fans with artists and creating ways for people to Live the music. The company provides access to a full-range catalog of high quality music, lossless HiFi audio and industry-defining features on a scalable platform available in 180+ countries. 

Founded in 2007 in Paris, Deezer is now a global company with around 550 people based in France, Germany, UK, Brazil and the US, all brought together by their passion for music, technology and innovation. By building strategic partnerships in key markets across Europe and the Americas, Deezer keeps delivering brand value and end-user engagement across a wide variety of industries, including telecommunications, media, audio hardware and e-retail.
 
As an industry thought leader, Deezer was the first platform to introduce a new monetization model since the inception of music streaming, designed to better reward the artists, and the music that fans value the most.

Deezer is listed on Euronext Paris (Ticker: DEEZR. ISIN: FR001400AYG6) and is also part of the Euronext Tech Leaders segment, dedicated to European high-growth tech companies, and its associated index.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Backend Engineer Intern
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Hi, we‚Äôre Back Market.

We‚Äôre here to help make tech reliable, affordable, and better than new. We're a global marketplace for refurbished devices, helping lower our collective environmental impact by providing trustworthy, affordable tech with 92% less carbon emissions than new.

Yep, you read that right. Turns out refurbished tech is way better for the planet than new. In fact, With every device purchased on Back Market, our positive impact on the planet grows. From our Customer Care representatives to our software engineer, every individual at Back Market cuts the planet ‚Äî and consumers ‚Äî a break. Our mission is simple: to do more with what we already have.

Are you ready to join us?

YOUR MISSION (IF YOU ACCEPT IT): ü•á

  • Collaborate with experienced engineers on feature development and system enhancements.
  • Support the team‚Äôs technical rework efforts, helping refine and optimize our codebase.

YOU ARE IN THE RIGHT PLACE IF: ‚≠ê

  • Mandatory!: Currently enrolled in your last year of an Engineering School with a backend specialization/ University Master's degree and your university can provide an internship agreement
  • You have knowledge of basic coding languages and ideally Python and have basic programming experience (github, personal or student projects).
  • You have knowledge of databases and operating systems, Linux is a plus.
  • You have the ability to learn new software and technologies quickly, being curious about the coding environment you‚Äôll evolve in.
  • You are detail-oriented and have the desire and ability to work in a team in an international environment.
  • You are fluent in English - French is a plus.
  • You are looking for a 6 month, full-time role (35h/week), internship from February/March - August/September 2026, based in Paris, France
  • You are authorized to work in France (EU Nationality or in possession of valid student visa/work permit).

ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP: ‚ÑπÔ∏è

  • Starting date: January 2026
  • Duration: 6 months
  • Full-time internship (35h/week - Monday to Friday)
  • Location: Paris, France

RECRUITMENT PROCESS: üìÖ

  • Video-call Interview with the Campus Tech Recruitment Manager (30min)
  • Video-call Technical fit interview : Live coding + open talk (45min) with the tutor
  • Video-call Team fit interview with 2 engineers/members from the team (30min)

WHY SHOULD YOU JOIN US ? ‚úåüèº

At Back Market, we‚Äôre committed to hiring and supporting diverse teams of people from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives ‚Äî it‚Äôs one of the reasons we‚Äôre such a high-scoring certified B Corp company (93.2).

Benefits

No matter your role and seniority level, you‚Äôll enjoy impact-driven work with hands-on career development in an innovative, driven, and fast-paced environment ‚Äî with benefits to match, like:

  • A mission driven work environment where your day to day makes an impact on the planet. Seriously.
  • Hybrid work environment, with 2 remote days a week and 1 remote work week per quarter, plus 3 flex days.
  • Employee Resource Groups, including mentorship programs, comprehensive accessibility policies, and cultural competency training.

At Back Market, we strive to create a workplace that embodies the world we‚Äôre trying to change. We‚Äôve embedded our diversity, equity, and inclusion principles into our DNA ‚Äî from dedicated staff to employee resource groups to our company values.

We know that the perfect background for a role doesn‚Äôt mean the perfect fit ‚Äî we encourage you to apply for a role even if you think you may not have all the qualifications.

If reasonable accommodations are needed for the interview process, please do not hesitate to discuss this with the Talent Acquisition Team.

Run an Actor and get dataset.companySlogan: Where the world shops refurbished tech.
Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
Founded in 2014 by Thibaud Hug de Larauze, Quentin Le Brouster, and Vianney Vaute, Back Market is a global marketplace for premium refurbished electronics. We‚Äôre here to help make refurbished tech trustworthy, reliable, and affordable. 

As a certified B-Corp, Back Market‚Äôs mission is to do more with what we already have. Because, well, what we already have is pretty great. That‚Äôs why all the tech you find on Back Market is better than new ‚Äî because not only is it in perfect working condition, independent scientific research shows that refurbished electronics have a significantly smaller footprint on the environment than brand new. Every time someone chooses refurbished tech, we avoid additional environmental impact on the planet.

Of course, it‚Äôs not just about the tech sold by sellers on our marketplace, it‚Äôs also about how we run our business ‚Äî we hold ourselves to high standards when it comes to our own sustainability practices, too. We work across the refurbishment industry to develop new technologies, support environmental initiatives related to electronic waste (e-waste), and work with local governments across the globe to pass legislation that supports sustainability and the Right to Repair in the tech industry. 


We know we‚Äôre not alone in our vision for a world where tech respects the planet. With 884M‚Ç¨ raised to date and over 10 million customers around the world, we‚Äôre well on our way to the joyful revolution of Tech Reborn. 

Are you ready to join us? 

‚Äî 

Learn about the environmental impact of refurbished tech: https://www.backmarket.com/en-us/c/news/impact-of-refurbished-on-environment

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Internship - Tampered text detection
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

We are looking for a motivated intern to design, implement, and evaluate deep learning algorithms capable of detecting text modifications created by text-editing algorithms also known as tampered text detection. The goal is to develop a solution that can detect a wide range of text-editing techniques accurately and with high speed.

The intern will join a team working on advanced algorithms for identity document authentication, contributing to important projects in document security.

Key Missions

  • Research and understand existing methods for tampered text detection
  • Design and implement novel deep learning models to detect text alterations
  • Evaluate and benchmark model performance across various text-editing algorithms
  • Collaborate with the team to integrate solutions into authentication workflows

Profile Description

Education

  • Engineering student in the final year of the engineering cycle, or a Master‚Äôs student specializing in deep learning, computer vision, and image processing.

Technical Skills

  • Strong foundation in image processing, computer vision, and deep learning (preferably with PyTorch)
  • Experience or strong interest in natural language processing and text-based AI techniques is a plus

Soft Skills & Languages

  • Curious, proactive, and autonomous
  • Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken

Run an Actor and get dataset.companySlogan: Secure Transactions
Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
IDEMIA Group is a global technology leader with more than 12 500 employees worldwide. Its two market-leading divisions deliver mission-critical solutions that simplify and secure interactions in the physical and digital realms:
 
‚Ä¢	IDEMIA Secure Transactions (IST) is the leading technology provider making it safer and easier to pay and connect. With unmatched expertise in cryptography and credential issuance, IST is trusted by over 2000 financial institutions, mobile operators, automotive manufacturers, and IoT providers worldwide. Every day, IST secures billions of essential transactions, ensuring the highest levels of data protection and convenience.
‚Ä¢	IDEMIA Public Security is a trusted provider of government-grade and convenient biometric-based solutions for 600 government, state and federal agencies. With decades of experience in biometric technologies, IPS enables safer, frictionless and fairer ways to secure travel, access and citizen protection.

For more information, visit www.idemia.com and follow @IDEMIAGroup on X.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: STAGE - Ing√©nieur de recherche en Deep Learning CAD (F/H)
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Sujet : IA g√©n√©rative pour la g√©n√©ration de CAO bas√©e sur des contraintes multimodales

Au sein du d√©partement Corporate Research de Dassault Syst√®mes, vous rejoindrez l‚Äô√©quipe ¬´ 3D Generative AI ¬ª, qui explore des probl√©matiques de recherche li√©es √† l‚Äôintelligence artificielle pour repousser les limites de la mod√©lisation 3D. L‚Äô√©quipe a pour mission principale d‚Äôinventer les technologies futures qui assisteront, optimiseront et automatiseront le processus de conception 3D gr√¢ce √† l‚ÄôIA g√©n√©rative, stimulant cr√©ativit√©, productivit√© et accessibilit√© dans divers secteurs industriels.

La Conception Assist√©e par Ordinateur (CAO) est la premi√®re √©tape de d√©veloppement d‚Äôun objet industriel avant de parvenir √† la phase de fabrication. Ce processus reste co√ªteux en temps et requiert une expertise avanc√©e des outils de g√©n√©ration 3D. Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
Nexter, the leading French land defense company is a KNDS (KMW+NEXTER Defense Systems) Group company. Nexter applies its expertise in land defense systems to meet the needs of the French army and other land forces around the world. The scope of its business includes the supply of weapon systems and ammunition for air and naval forces. 

The acquisition of Belgian company Mecar and Italian company Simmel Difesa enabled the establishment, along with Nexter Munitions, of the third European player in the ammunition sector. 

The group continues its international development policy with 60% of order intake in 2016 destined for the export market. In France, Nexter is fully committed to meeting the objectives of the SCORPION program, through the renovation of the Leclerc tank and the development of the future VBMR GRIFFON and EBRC JAGUAR vehicles within the GME (temporary consortium: Nexter/Renault Trucks Defense/Thales). 

Nexter's 2016 turnover amounted to ‚Ç¨866 million, of which 19% is allocated to Research and Development activities. The group's range of products consists of ARAVIS¬Æ, TITUS¬Æ and VBCI armoured vehicles, CAESAR¬Æ, TRAJAN¬Æ and 105LG1 artillery systems, smart ammunition (BONUS), as well as customer service, support and recycling.

Nexter is looking for new talents, come and have a look at our dedicated website (http://nexter-recrutement.profils.org)

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Internship - Methods and Data Engineer F/M
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

About us:

Technip Energies is a global technology and engineering powerhouse. With leadership position in LNG, hydrogen, ethylene, sustainable chemistry, and CO2 management, we are contributing to the development of critical markets such as energy, energy derivatives, decarbonization, and circularity. Our complementary business segments, Technology, Products and Services (TPS) and Project Delivery, turn innovation into scalable and industrial reality.

Through collaboration and excellence in execution, our 17,000+ employees across 34 countries are fully committed to bridging prosperity with sustainability for a world designed to last.

About the mission we offer you:

Within the Engineering division of Technip Energies' (T.EN) Paris office, you will report to the Information Management department.

With 60 years of experience in energy project design, the division is made up of 600 people representing all disciplines present on our facilities (>20).

Driven by the T.EN group's values of inclusion, the Engineering division relies on the diversity of its members to progress. This means that this position is open to everyone and that your application will be specifically reviewed.

As part of a multicultural task force, you will participate in the Digital Acceleration Plan launched within the company, which includes 70 initiatives. You will be integrated into the Data Continuity team, which works across the board on key initiatives in support of the business teams.

Your day-to-day work:

Within the Engineering division and the Information Management department, as part of a project team, you will report to the Information Management manager, who will be your internship supervisor.

The role of the Data Continuity team is to help business representatives identify the data relevant to the initiative, link it to processes, model it, and structure it to propose a data model that is relevant and consistent with the existing one.

The objective of the internship is to support the Data Continuity team in its various tasks:

  • Participate in discussions with business representatives to help them better formalize their needs.
  • Map the processes concerned.
  • Analyze data files to understand what the key data are, the links between them and with the processes. Create an initial model of the whole.
  • Participate in the various workshops of the initiative and report on the Data Continuity aspects.
  • Review the various deliverables (mock-ups, prototypes, etc.) to ensure that data continuity aspects have been properly integrated/complied with
  • Develop the conceptual data model and formalize recommendations for the final product


The added bonus of the internship:

  • Work in a multicultural team, in an international context, in a center of engineering excellence in the field of energy
  • Internship offering the opportunity to work with multiple disciplines, with a cross-functional view of work processes


Starting Date: January 2026

About you:

  • Currently in your final year at an engineering school with a strong interest in data, you are looking for an end-of-studies internship. You have experience in quality processes and data analysis from a previous internship or student projects.
  • Interested in engineering and the energy sector, you are eager to learn and have a proactive attitude towards acquiring new skills and applying them effectively.
  • You are able to adapt to different contexts and people, as each digital initiative is different, and you are motivated to apply new methodologies and develop them further.
  • You have a strong interest in processes and data structuring/modeling, while using your technical background to facilitate understanding.
  • You have a good command of English and are comfortable working with English-speaking colleagues on a daily basis.


Your career development at TEN could lead to a role as a Methods & Data Engineer after graduation, continuing to work within the Digital Acceleration Plan. Technip Energies encourages internal and intra-group mobility (expatriation or local international contracts), and a move to other cross-functional departments is possible.

Your career with us

Working at Technip Energies is an inspiring journey, filled with groundbreaking projects and dynamic collaborations. Surrounded by diverse and talented individuals, you will feel welcomed, respected, and engaged. Enjoy a safe, caring environment where you can spark new ideas, reimagine the future, and lead change. As your career grows, you will benefit from learning opportunities at T.EN University, such as The Future Ready Program, Graduate Program, and from the support of your manager through check-in moments like the Mid-Year Development Review, fostering continuous growth and development.

What‚Äôs Next?

Once receiving your system application, our recruiting team will screen and match your skills, experience, and potential team fit against the role requirements. We ask for your patience as the team completes the volume of applications with reasonable timeframe. Check your application progress periodically via personal account from created candidate profile during your application.

We invite you to get to know more about our company by visiting www.ten.com and follow us on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, X and YouTube for company updates.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Site Reliability Engineer Apprentice (1+ years)
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
What if, in your next adventure, you were surrounded by people who, like you, look for an unlimited playground to explore, share, and test, would you care to hear more? You've opened the right door! As an R&D team, making sure your ideas are heard and encouraged is what we strive to do!

What You'll Do:

Join the CIAM (Customer Identity and Access Management ) team and contribute to AuthZilla, our cutting-edge authorization system based on OpenFGA and the Google Zanzibar model. This apprenticeship offers a unique opportunity to dive into the world of authorization security, combining software development and site reliability engineering (SRE) practices.

As an apprentice, you will:

Design, implement, deploy, and monitor features within the AuthZilla project.

Work in an agile Kanban team, collaborating closely with experienced engineers.

Support the migration and adoption of your implemented features across teams.

Gain hands-on experience with ReBAC (Relationship-Based Access Control) systems.

You'll be exposed to a modern tech stack and engineering practices, including: Frontend: Angular

Backend: C#, Python

SRE Tools: Kubernetes, Kibana, Monitoring & Alerting

Who You Are:

  • You are currently/will be enrolled in a Computer Science or related technical program, and your school can provide an apprenticeship contract.
  • You are a Masters student looking for 1+ years of apprenticeship, looking for 3 weeks in office and 1 week at school or 4 days in office and 1 day at school.
  • You have basic development skills and are eager to grow in both frontend and backend technologies.
  • You're curious about authorization systems, security, and SRE practices.
  • You have some experience or interest in: Object-Oriented Programming (C#, Python, Java) Web-based applications and Linux fundamentals Frontend frameworks like Angular or React API design and development.
  • You're a team player, a strong communicator, and fluent in English.
  • You're excited to learn, contribute, and make an impact in a production-grade system used at scale.


We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is a leader in commerce media, helping brands, agencies, and publishers create meaningful consumer connections through AI-powered advertising solutions. We‚Äôre shaping a more open and sustainable digital future for advertising.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices across the globe or from the comfort of home, our 3,600 Criteos collaborate together to build an open, impactful, and forward-thinking environment.

We foster a workplace where everyone is valued, and employment decisions are based solely on skills, qualifications, and business needs‚Äînever on non-job-related factors or legally protected characteristics.

What We Offer:

üè¢ Ways of working ‚Äì Our hybrid model blends home with in-office experiences, making space for both.

üìà Grow with us ‚Äì Learning, mentorship & career development programs.

üí™ Your wellbeing matters ‚Äì Health benefits, wellness perks & mental health support.

ü§ù A team that cares ‚Äì Diverse, inclusive, and globally connected.

üí∏ Fair pay & perks ‚Äì Attractive salary, with performance-based rewards and family-friendly policies, plus the potential for equity depending on role and level.

Additional benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo.

Qui sommes-nous ?

En tant que stagiaire Ing√©nieur Logiciel chez Artefact, tu seras int√©gr√©(e) au sein d'une √©quipe de d√©veloppement et tu participeras activement √† la conception et √† l'impl√©mentation de solutions techniques robustes et scalables. Sous la supervision de ton tuteur, tes missions seront les suivantes :

  • Architecture logicielle : Contribuer √† la r√©flexion sur l'architecture de nos applications, en veillant √† la performance et √† la maintenabilit√© du code
  • D√©ploiement et op√©rations (DevOps) :  automatisation des tests et des d√©ploiements cloud avec des pipelines CI/CD et une infrastructure en tant que code (ex : Terraform), packaging d'applications dans des conteneurs (ex : Docker), impl√©mentation d'outils d'observabilit√© des donn√©es (ex : DBT)
  • D√©ploiement de ton logiciel sur le cloud : GCP, AWS ou Azure  
  • D√©ploiement d‚Äôune ou plusieurs expertises techniques suivantes : d√©veloppement logiciel, ing√©nierie analytique, ing√©nierie ML, architecture cloud ou ing√©nierie de s√©curit√© et de fiabilit√© des sites

Profil recherch√©
  • Formation : Tu es √©tudiant(e) en derni√®re ann√©e de cycle ing√©nieur, Master 2, ou √©quivalent, avec une sp√©cialisation en g√©nie logiciel, informatique, ou d√©veloppement web et tu recherches ton stage de fin d‚Äô√©tudes √† partir de Janvier 2026
  • Comp√©tences techniques :
    • Ma√Ætrise d'un ou plusieurs langages de programmation comme Python, Java, JavaScript (Node.js), Go ou Scala.
    • Connaissance des principes de la programmation orient√©e objet et/ou de la programmation fonctionnelle.
    • Exp√©rience avec des bases de donn√©es SQL ou NoSQL.
    • Une familiarit√© avec le Cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) et les conteneurs (Docker, Kubernetes) est un atout.
    • Connaissance des outils de versioning, en particulier Git.
  • Qualit√©s personnelles :
    • Curiosit√© et proactivit√© : Tu as envie d'apprendre et de proposer de nouvelles id√©es.
    • Rigueur et souci du d√©tail : Tu es soucieux(se) de produire un code propre et de qualit√©.
    • Esprit d'√©quipe : Tu es capable de travailler en collaboration et d'√©changer avec des profils vari√©s (Data Scientists, Consultants, etc.)
    • Fran√ßais courant pour travailler en √©quipe et anglais professionnel obligatoire pour nos clients internationaux 

Le processus de recrutement : pour rejoindre Artefact, nous te proposons un processus de recrutement en quatre √©tapes durant lequel tu auras l‚Äôoccasion de parler de ton exp√©rience et d'en apprendre davantage sur Artefact et le poste d'ing√©nieur logiciel.

  • Entretien RH
  • Entretien #1 ‚Äì Test de codage avec un Senior Software Engineer 
  • Entretien #2 - Test d'architecture et de pipeline avec un Senior Software Engineer 
  • Entretien #3 - Entretien de motivation avec le Directeur du p√¥le Data Engineering 

Processus d'onboarding : 

L'int√©gration comprend une formation sur des comp√©tences transversales critiques telles que la gestion du temps, la communication orale et √©crite. Un mentor te sera √©galement attribu√© qui te guidera dans ta familiarisation avec la culture et les m√©thodes de travail de l'entreprise. De plus, tu auras l'opportunit√© de travailler sur des projets internes pour acqu√©rir une exp√©rience pratique et perfectionner tes comp√©tences. De plus, tu auras la possibilit√© d'obtenir des certifications sur les fournisseurs cloud avant de travailler sur des missions clients. Ce processus d'int√©gration est con√ßu pour te doter des connaissances et des comp√©tences n√©cessaires pour devenir un ing√©nieur logiciel performant chez Artefact.

Ce que nous offrons

  • Un environnement de travail stimulant, o√π tu seras encourag√©(e) √† prendre des initiatives.
  • Un accompagnement par un mentor exp√©riment√© pour te faire progresser rapidement.
  • L'opportunit√© de travailler sur des projets vari√©s et complexes.
  • La possibilit√© d'√™tre embauch√©(e) en CDI √† la fin du stage.

Run an Actor and get dataset.companySlogan: French association of investors for growth
Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
Founded in 1984, France Invest is the industry association representing French private equity professionals. Its role is to promote this asset class to institutional investors, this funding method and support to entrepreneurs, and this leading economic sector to opinion leaders and public authorities. 

The association itself is home to 359 asset management companies and nearly 200 associate members from all the business lines that support and advise investors and entrepreneurs in setting up and managing their partnerships. Our membership supports and finances more than 7,700 of the most dynamic startups, SMEs and mid-caps, employing more than 1.3 million people in France.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Internship - Query image retrieval
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Job Description

We are seeking a motivated intern to design, implement, and evaluate deep learning algorithms for the query image retrieval task, specifically applied to identity documents. The solution will need to discriminate between images with subtle differences, such as text written in different fonts or with a single character variation.

The intern will join a team focused on developing advanced algorithms for identity document authentication, contributing to projects that enhance document security.

Key Missions

  • Research and analyze state-of-the-art query image retrieval methods
  • Develop deep learning models capable of detecting fine-grained differences in images
  • Evaluate model accuracy and efficiency on relevant datasets
  • Collaborate with the team to implement and integrate solutions

Profile Description

Education

  • Engineering student in the final year of the engineering cycle, or a Master‚Äôs student specializing in deep learning, computer vision, and image processing

Technical Skills

  • Strong background in image processing, computer vision, and deep learning (preferably with PyTorch)

Soft Skills & Languages

  • Curious, proactive, and autonomous
  • Fluent in English, both spoken and written

As a game-changer in sustainable technology and innovation, Dassault Syst√®mes is striving to build more inclusive and diverse teams across the globe. Job Description

Internship - Junior Data Scientist (F/M)

Internship ‚Äì Junior Data Scientist (F/M)

Paris ‚Äì La D√©fense

This is Worldline

Worldline helps businesses of all shapes and sizes to accelerate their growth journey - quickly, simply, and securely. We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. Our technology powers the growth of millions of businesses across 5 continents. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The O pportunity

Under the supervision of the Head of Sales Analytics, you will manage projects in the framework of the analytics engine aiming at monitoring the sales and marketing performance of the GBL via multiple KPIs reflecting most of business metrics, with a purpose of feeding all layers of the management up to the FS board, as well as providing each Sales individuals with their own KPIs with regards to their targets.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Manage BI projects
  • Collect business requirements
  • Propose functional and technical solutions
  • Implement and roll-out solutions
  • Document and train people
  • Manage evolutions.

Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what‚Äôs next ‚Äì people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:

  • Student in an engineering school preparing a master in data-science
  • Open mindset, curious, with good analytical skills.
  • Good writing and interpersonal skills.
  • Willing to work in an international context.
  • English as working language

Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you‚Äôll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide.
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career.
  • Monthly compensation paid by bank transfer
  • Access to our company restaurant
  • Access to CSE benefits

Shape the evolution

We are pushing towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers to join our journey. People with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you‚Äôll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. And with our empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career. Wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of over 18,000 innovators across 40+ countries, and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at jobs.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Data Operations Engineer Intern (M/F/X) - Paris
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
About Crossbeam


It‚Äôs an exciting time at Crossbeam. We built our company on a simple but powerful realization: partner ecosystems hold untapped potential to transform how companies go to market. That insight became a movement, now embraced by more than 30,000 companies using Crossbeam to unlock new data, build new growth engines, and provide powerful new market context to their AI agents. We‚Äôre scaling with speed, focus, and a vision that‚Äôs reshaping the future of go-to-market, backed by top-tier investors like Andreessen Horowitz, Insight Partners, Redpoint, FirstMark, Salesforce Ventures, and HubSpot Ventures (yep, the biggest CRMs are investing in the future of go-to-market).


The opportunity ahead is exciting, and we‚Äôre pursuing it with curiosity, high standards, and a shared commitment to doing the best work of our careers.


Our Revenue Operations (RevOps) team helps different departments like Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success work together smoothly by managing data, tools, and processes. Our goal is to make sure the company grows revenue efficiently and consistently.


Our team is increasingly in demand and is becoming more and more transversal in our growing structure. Therefore, you will hold a central role in a dynamic and innovative team where you'll gain insight into the organization's inner mechanics and understand its operational processes.


Working closely with the Revenue Operations Manager, you will have the opportunity to gain practical experience, enhance operational skills, collaborate with multiple teams, and develop robust technical skills across various SaaS platforms:


  • Salesforce at the heart of the Revenue team‚Äôs processes;
  • Snowflake, Segment, Census, Stitch and Mode for Data;
  • Salesoft for Sales engagement
  • Clay, Apollo and Hubspot for Growth and Marketing;
  • Ironclad, Maxio for Revenue;
  • Chili Piper, Zapier, etc.


You can find additional resources about the scope of a Revenue Operations team here.


YOUR MISSIONS WILL BE


  • Assist the operations team in implementing strategic projects and managing daily operations.
  • Improve our lead scoring models based on product, marketing and ecosystem data
  • Analyze pipeline conversion rates to identify growth levers
  • Monitor the sales opportunity management process
  • Identify bottlenecks in our company‚Äôs operations and develop initiatives to improve our efficiency
  • Create sales and customer data visualizations for our teams to help them pilot their activity and track their results
  • Implement AI agents and workflows to multiply our productivity
  • Foster effective communication and collaboration between operations management and sales, success, product and other stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals, priorities, and timeline.


YOUR BACKGROUND


  • You have some experience working with data
  • Ideally, you have completed a previous internship in Operations, Sales or Product within a fast-paced Saas environment;
  • or have interned in a structured setting (VC, Private Equity, M&A, Consulting).
  • Final-year or second-half of gap year internship;
  • Start date in late February or early March 2026.


HIRING PROCESS


  • The journey starts with a first interview with the HR Generalist (30min);
  • This will then be followed by a Case study to validate your practical job-related skills;
  • Then a face-to-face meeting with the Revenue Operations Manager (1 hour);
  • For the very final round, a culture fit interview with our VP Operations and Strategy and the rest of the team.


BENEFITS


  • 50% reimbursement of your public transport pass (Navigo).
  • A work computer provided for the duration of your internship.
  • Meal allowance.


OUR CORE VALUES


Values are a social contract that we have with our team, our users, and our communities. They are guiding lights as well as argument-enders, and we expect results delivered in a way that is consistent with these values.


Trust is our Foundation

We create value by building trust in our company, our team, and our technology. That goes in all directions, not just between us and our customers but also amongst ourselves. We approach conflict with empathy and curiosity, and ascribe best intentions to all of our collaborators.


Work Hard and Smart

This is a startup, and we will act like one. We prioritize impact, take personal ownership of outcomes, act decisively, and get our hands dirty in the process. We communicate clearly, avoid over-engineering, and take risks. This allows us to be creative, innovative, and solution-oriented.


Default to Transparency

We will not succeed in information silos. We share the good, bad, and ugly about what is happening in our company, which requires us to pay attention, always measure what matters, and hold each other accountable.


Belonging

In our workplaces, communities, and ecosystems, we shape environments where people feel a sense of belonging. To do this, we work to ensure that stakeholders of all backgrounds are treated equitably and experience psychological and physical safety. This is key to their relationship with our company, their access to opportunities, and their ability to thrive.


Treasure the Fun

We are incredibly lucky to be here - let‚Äôs make memories. We will all spend that extra bit of time and energy to energize each other with fun and inspiring experiences. This applies internally and externally, from the smallest interactions to the largest events.

Crossbeam's core value of Equity sits at the heart of our hiring process, and we're proud to be building a culture where differences are valued. Applicants from diverse and non-traditional backgrounds are strongly encouraged to apply.


Equal Opportunity Employer

We‚Äôre proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to building a team that reflects a wide variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We don‚Äôt discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic.


If you need reasonable accommodations during any part of the application or interview process, please let us know - we‚Äôre happy to support you.

Description de l‚Äôentreprise

Institution financi√®re internationale de premier plan, Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking met √† disposition des entreprises, institutions financi√®res, fonds d‚Äôinvestissement, agences souveraines et supranationales une palette de services en conseil, investment banking, financements, banque commerciale et sur les march√©s de capitaux.

Ses √©quipes d‚Äôexperts, pr√©sentes dans environ 30 pays, conseillent les clients sur leur d√©veloppement strat√©gique en les accompagnant dans le d√©veloppement et la transformation de leurs activit√©s tout en maximisant leur impact positif. Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking s‚Äôengage sur un alignement de son portefeuille de financements sur une trajectoire de neutralit√© carbone d‚Äôici √† 2050, tout en aidant ses clients √† r√©duire l‚Äôimpact environnemental de leur activit√©.

Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking fait partie du Groupe BPCE, deuxi√®me groupe bancaire en France √† travers les r√©seaux Banque Populaire et Caisse d‚ÄôEpargne. Elle b√©n√©ficie de la puissance financi√®re et des solides notations du Groupe (Standard & Poor's : A+, Moody's : A1, Fitch Ratings: A+, R&I : A+).

Poste et missions

Vous rejoignez notre √©quipe MS PNL (Metrics Services Profit & Loss), qui recherche un Data Ing√©nieur pour un stage de 6 mois, √† partir de f√©vrier 2026.

Le service, compos√© d'une dizaine de personnes, correspond aux √©quipes Big Data travaillant sur le P&L.

En collaboration avec votre tuteur, vos missions principales seront :

  • D√©velopper, tester et livrer les fonctionnalit√©s demand√©es par le m√©tier ;
  • S‚Äôassurer du bon d√©roulement de la production en apportant assistance au support lors de probl√®mes critiques ;
  • Effectuer une veille technologique et piloter la maintenance de notre p√©rim√®tre.

Les 3 p√©rim√®tres couverts par ces √©quipes sont :

  • Le calcul des Fair Value Adjustments (FairVA) et des AVA ;
  • Le calcul du DOPDOR : provision de P&L li√©e √† l'observabilit√© d'un instrument ;
  • L'explication du P&L par les sensibilit√©s. Cela permet d'expliquer la variation du P&L entre deux journ√©es par les diff√©rents effets de march√© : volatilit√©, √©volution de la valeur du sous-jacent, taux d'int√©r√™t, etc.

En tant que membre de cette √©quipe, vous participerez √† l'am√©lioration de ces trois p√©rim√®tres. Les t√¢ches sont tr√®s diverses : parfois fonctionnelles dans l'impl√©mentation d'une nouvelle r√®gle m√©tier, parfois techniques pour l'optimisation des processus. Nous appr√©cierons notamment votre curiosit√© et votre motivation √† prendre des initiatives.

#FinanceTransformative

En tant que Top Employer, nous pla√ßons nos collaborateurs au centre de nos attentions. Des dispositifs de mobilit√© interne, d√©veloppement de carri√®re et de formation vous permettent de grandir et de vous √©panouir tout au long de votre parcours.

Vous √©voluez dans un environnement de travail inclusif et favorisant le collaboratif qui vous donnera toutes les chances de r√©ussir cette nouvelle mission.

Vous avez √©galement la possibilit√© de vous engager en faveur de la soci√©t√© et de causes qui vous tiennent √† c≈ìur via notre fondation d‚Äôentreprise.

Vous b√©n√©ficiez d‚Äôune indemnit√© de stage en fonction de votre formation et de votre niveau d‚Äô√©tudes, √©galement d‚Äôun remboursement de votre titre de transport √† hauteur de 60 %, d‚Äôun jour d‚Äôabsence autoris√© pay√© pour chaque mois travaill√© et de l‚Äôacc√®s au restaurant de l‚Äôentreprise.

Profil et comp√©tences requises

√âtudiant de niveau BAC+5 pr√©parant un dipl√¥me (universitaire, d‚Äô√©cole de commerce ou d‚Äô√©cole d‚Äôing√©nieur), avec une sp√©cialisation en Data Engineering. Vous disposez de connaissances dans les langages de programmation permettant le calcul distribu√© (Spark/Scala, Python, SQL, Git, Kubernetes pour les tests). Vous avez un excellent relationnel et une tr√®s bonne capacit√© d‚Äô√©coute. Vous √™tes reconnu pour votre esprit logique, votre rigueur et votre curiosit√©. Et enfin, vous parlez parfaitement anglais. Vous serez contact√© par l‚Äôun de nos recruteurs avant de rencontrer nos experts m√©tier, un moment d‚Äô√©change id√©al pour mettre en avant votre personnalit√© ainsi que votre projet.

Natixis Corporate & Investment Banking is a leading global financial institution that provides advisory, investment banking, financing, corporate banking and capital markets services to corporations, financial institutions, financial sponsors and sovereign and supranational organizations worldwide.

Run an Actor and get dataset.title: Intern (6 months) Global Performance Analytics
Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
Opella, the Consumer Healthcare business unit of Sanofi, is the purest and third-largest player globally in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market.

We have an unshakable belief in the power of self-care and the role it can play in creating a healthier society and a healthier planet.

That‚Äôs why we want to make self-care as simple as it should be by being consumer-led always, with science at our core.

Through our unique and balanced portfolio of more than 100 loved brands, including 15 global and local high-growth challengers such as Allegra, Dulcolax and Buscopan, we deliver our mission: helping more than half a billion consumers worldwide take their health in their hands.

This mission is brought to life by an 11,000-strong team, 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites, and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers.

We are also proud to be the first major fast-moving consumer healthcare company to achieve B Corp certification.

Join us on our mission. Health. In your hands.

We are looking for an intern (6 months) to join our CXA Global Performance Analytics team in Neuilly sur Seine. You will be part of the global analytics team (Business Intelligence) and contribute to the analytics vision of enabling decision making based on clear analytical insights.

Key Responsibilities

  • Support and assist business intelligence analysis projects, using secondary data available on demand (sell-out) either via Microsoft Excel Spreadsheet (XLS) (including pivot, cubes) or from ad hoc Dashboards (e.g., Power BI)
  • Create Dashboards to help retrieve business insights
  • Support in understanding market dynamics and relationship with variables through panel data case studies
  • Support Global Brand teams to track and understand their past and future performance vs. market, including key drivers. Generate and improve respective market data reports in PowerPoint Presentations (PPT)
  • Present results using existing Dashboards
  • Work as needed on data definition, acquisition, and quality checks
  • Work on additional projects like competitive intelligence, innovation tracking, forecasting, marketing mix, or other type of analytics
  • Be part of the business intelligence team and work with stakeholders across functions and countries
  • Learn about the skills of market intelligence & analytics, project management, consultancy in in a global leading Fast Moving Consumer HealthCare/Goods (FMCH/G) company
  • Assist in other market research projects or systems should help be required

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Experience: Previous internship in wide over the counter (OTC) or Fast Moving Consumer Goods is a plus
  • Soft skills: Collaboration, reactivity, positive attitude, data-driven, rigor, ability to explain complex analytics into simple yet compelling business stories
  • Technical skills: At ease with MS- Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint etc.,), Good in Math/Statistics/Strategy courses, Skills in data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau) and programming (e.g., Python, R, SQL and JSON/VEGA) or data warehouse software (e.g., Snowflake) would be an asset
  • Education: you are preparing a master's degree in data science/ data analysis/ and/or mathematics/statistics (master‚Äôs preferred) and you have a convention de stage delivered by your University or School.
  • Languages: English

Opella is the self-care challenger with the purest and third-largest portfolio in the Over-The-Counter (OTC) & Vitamins, Minerals & Supplements (VMS) market globally.

Our mission is to bring health in people‚Äôs hands by making self-care as simple as it should be. For half a billion consumers worldwide ‚Äì and counting.

At the core of this mission is our 100 loved brands, our 11,000-strong global team, our 13 best-in-class manufacturing sites and 4 specialized science and innovation development centers. 

Headquartered in France, Opella is the proud maker of many of the world‚Äôs most loved brands, including Allegra, Buscopan, Doliprane, Dulcolax, Enterogermina, Essentiale and Mucosolvan. 

As a globally certified B Corp company, we are active players in the journey towards healthier people and planet. 

Find out more about our mission on our website.

Run an Actor and get dataset.descriptionHtml:
En tant qu‚Äô√©tudiant, venez vivre une exp√©rience valorisante‚Ä¶

Vous recherchez des missions concr√®tes et professionnalisantes aupr√®s d‚Äô√©quipes dynamiques et bienveillantes ? Que vous soyez stagiaire ou alternant, vous prendrez part √† des projets √† haute valeur ajout√©e et serez accompagn√© par des managers et coll√®gues passionn√©s. Plus de 95% de nos √©tudiants nous recommandent d‚Äôailleurs pour r√©aliser un stage ou un apprentissage (label Happy Trainees).

Notre objectif : vous aider √† construire votre projet professionnel tout en vous apprenant votre futur m√©tier. En moyenne, nous recrutons un √©tudiant sur deux √† l‚Äôissue de son exp√©rience chez MBDA‚Ä¶ Pourquoi pas vous ?

Votre environnement de travail

Au sein de la Direction Software Engineering, vous √™tes int√©gr√©(e) au service ¬´ Logiciels Syst√®mes C2 & IT ¬ª. Les logiciels C2 (centre de contr√¥le et de commande) aident √† la prise de d√©cision tactiques et la supervision des syst√®mes de missiles ou des contre-mesures. Les logiciels IT (Installation de Tir) sont en interface avec le vecteur, ils contribuent √† la cha√Æne de s√©curit√© globale du syst√®me et permettent de d√©rouler la s√©quence de tir.

Le d√©partement favorise l‚Äôutilisation de processus r√©cents et novateurs, comme l‚Äôagilit√© par exemple, au sein de ses projets. Vous travaillerez donc au sein d‚Äô√©quipes jeunes, dynamiques, avides de nouvelles technologies et curieuses de s‚Äôessayer √† de nouvelles m√©thodologies de d√©veloppement.

Rejoignez la direction qui soutient nos programmes dans la conduite des activit√©s d‚Äôing√©nierie et des essais, qui met en ≈ìuvre les m√©thodes d‚Äôoptimisation de notre excellence technique et qui garantit un service optimal aupr√®s de nos clients !

Objectif de votre stage :

D√©velopper un outil permettant de rendre le suivi d‚Äôune menace plus naturel au sein d‚Äôun syst√®me de d√©fense anti-a√©rienne, via l‚Äôint√©gration d‚Äôun casque de r√©alit√© virtuelle dans le logiciel de l‚Äôinstallation de tir.

Votre quotidien

Gr√¢ce √† vos comp√©tences, vous :

  • Montez en comp√©tence sur l‚Äôutilisation du syst√®me existant et du casque de r√©alit√© virtuelle retenu ;
  • Apprenez √† utiliser la plateforme logicielle en C++ ;
  • Concevez, d√©veloppez et testez une brique logicielle r√©alisant l‚Äôinterface entre l‚Äôenvironnement VR et le rendu cam√©ra ;
  • R√©alisez la documentation associ√©e au projet.


En transverse, vous aurez la possibilit√© de soumettre vos id√©es et de faire √©merger des sujets qui s‚Äôinscriront dans le cadre innovant de l‚Äôentreprise.

Votre profil

Actuellement en derni√®re ann√©e d‚Äôun cycle Ing√©nieur ou √©quivalent avec une sp√©cialit√© en Logiciel.

Vous poss√©dez des connaissances en langage C / C++ et en Mod√©lisation UML. Des connaissances sur la plateforme de d√©veloppement 3D Unity, sur l'API OpenGL / OpenXR ou encore sur les technologies li√©es aux casques virtuels (Oculus Quest 2 ou HTC Vive Pro) seraient un plus.

Compte tenu de l'environnement international de la soci√©t√©, un bon niveau d'anglais est requis.

Dur√©e du stage : 6 mois conventionn√©s

Date de d√©but : √† partir de f√©vrier 2026 (modulable)

Les d√©fis technologiques de l‚Äôindustrie de d√©fense vous motivent ? Envoyez-nous votre candidature !

Adaptabilit√©

Curiosit√©

Esprit d'√©quipe

Force de proposition

R√©tributions et avantages

A world leader in missiles and missile systems. 

Our multi-national organisation is made up of around 13,000 employees working across the UK, France, Italy, Germany, Spain and the US, and is the first truly integrated European defence company.

As the European champion in our sector, our vision is to continue to grow our presence as a global player. Our mission is to achieve this by establishing ourselves as an industry leader; promoting co-operation and delivering technical and operational excellence to our customer.

Our values are: 
‚Ä¢ Innovation:	
Ensuring operational and strategic advantage;
‚Ä¢ Commitment:	
Always delivering on our promises;

A reliable and trusted partner with the highest professional and ethical standards;
‚Ä¢ Passion:	
Applying all our energy and focus to every task, recognising our role in providing mission critical capabilities;
‚Ä¢ Team Spirit:
Harnessing our diversity and collective purpose to deliver competitive advantage to all of our stakeholders.

We have a rich heritage of designing and producing missiles and missile systems to meet the whole range of current and future operational requirements for the three armed forces (army, navy, air force). We are proud to be a trusted partner to our armed forces and work with them to deliver a cutting-edge portfolio of products.

A world leader in missiles and missile systems. 

Our multi-national organisation is made up of around 13,000 employees working across the UK, France, Italy, Germany, Spain and the US, and is the first truly integrated European defence company.

As the European champion in our sector, our vision is to continue to grow our presence as a global player. Our mission is to achieve this by establishing ourselves as an industry leader; promoting co-operation and delivering technical and operational excellence to our customer.

Our values are:

Ensuring operational and strategic advantage;
‚Ä¢ Commitment:	
Always delivering on our promises;
‚Ä¢ Integrity:		
A reliable and trusted partner with the highest professional and ethical standards;
‚Ä¢ Passion:	
Applying all our energy and focus to every task, recognising our role in providing mission critical capabilities;
‚Ä¢ Team Spirit:
Harnessing our diversity and collective purpose to deliver competitive advantage to all of our stakeholders.

We have a rich heritage of designing and producing missiles and missile systems to meet the whole range of current and future operational requirements for the three armed forces (army, navy, air force). We are proud to be a trusted partner to our armed forces and work with them to deliver a cutting-edge portfolio of products.

Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
A world leader in missiles and missile systems. 

Our multi-national organisation is made up of around 13,000 employees working across the UK, France, Italy, Germany, Spain and the US, and is the first truly integrated European defence company.

As the European champion in our sector, our vision is to continue to grow our presence as a global player. Our mission is to achieve this by establishing ourselves as an industry leader; promoting co-operation and delivering technical and operational excellence to our customer.

Our values are: 
‚Ä¢ Innovation:	
Ensuring operational and strategic advantage;
‚Ä¢ Commitment:	
Always delivering on our promises;
‚Ä¢ Integrity:		
A reliable and trusted partner with the highest professional and ethical standards;
‚Ä¢ Passion:	
Applying all our energy and focus to every task, recognising our role in providing mission critical capabilities;
‚Ä¢ Team Spirit:
Harnessing our diversity and collective purpose to deliver competitive advantage to all of our stakeholders.

We have a rich heritage of designing and producing missiles and missile systems to meet the whole range of current and future operational requirements for the three armed forces (army, navy, air force). We are proud to be a trusted partner to our armed forces and work with them to deliver a cutting-edge portfolio of products.

Votre environnement de travail

Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
A world leader in missiles and missile systems. 

Our multi-national organisation is made up of around 13,000 employees working across the UK, France, Italy, Germany, Spain and the US, and is the first truly integrated European defence company.

As the European champion in our sector, our vision is to continue to grow our presence as a global player. Our mission is to achieve this by establishing ourselves as an industry leader; promoting co-operation and delivering technical and operational excellence to our customer.

Our values are: 
‚Ä¢ Innovation:	
Ensuring operational and strategic advantage;
‚Ä¢ Commitment:	
Always delivering on our promises;
‚Ä¢ Integrity:		
A reliable and trusted partner with the highest professional and ethical standards;
‚Ä¢ Passion:	
Applying all our energy and focus to every task, recognising our role in providing mission critical capabilities;
‚Ä¢ Team Spirit:
Harnessing our diversity and collective purpose to deliver competitive advantage to all of our stakeholders.

We have a rich heritage of designing and producing missiles and missile systems to meet the whole range of current and future operational requirements for the three armed forces (army, navy, air force). We are proud to be a trusted partner to our armed forces and work with them to deliver a cutting-edge portfolio of products.

Run an Actor and get dataset.companySlogan: Excellence at your side.
Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
A world leader in missiles and missile systems. 

Our multi-national organisation is made up of around 13,000 employees working across the UK, France, Italy, Germany, Spain and the US, and is the first truly integrated European defence company.

As the European champion in our sector, our vision is to continue to grow our presence as a global player. Our mission is to achieve this by establishing ourselves as an industry leader; promoting co-operation and delivering technical and operational excellence to our customer.

Our values are: 
‚Ä¢ Innovation:	
Ensuring operational and strategic advantage;
‚Ä¢ Commitment:	
Always delivering on our promises;
‚Ä¢ Integrity:		
A reliable and trusted partner with the highest professional and ethical standards;
‚Ä¢ Passion:	
Applying all our energy and focus to every task, recognising our role in providing mission critical capabilities;
‚Ä¢ Team Spirit:
Harnessing our diversity and collective purpose to deliver competitive advantage to all of our stakeholders.

We have a rich heritage of designing and producing missiles and missile systems to meet the whole range of current and future operational requirements for the three armed forces (army, navy, air force). We are proud to be a trusted partner to our armed forces and work with them to deliver a cutting-edge portfolio of products.

Run an Actor and get dataset.companyDescription:
BNP Paribas is a leading bank in Europe with an international reach. It has a presence in 64 countries, with more than 178,000 employees, including more than 144,000 in Europe. 
BNP Paribas holds leading positions in its three major operating divisions:

‚öÜ Commercial, Personal Banking & Services for all the Group‚Äôs retail banking networks and several specialised businesses, including BNP Paribas Personal Finance and Arval;
‚öÜ Investment & Protection Services for savings, investment and protection solutions; 
‚öÜ Corporate & Institutional Banking, which is focused on corporate and institutional clients.

The Group helps all its clients (individuals, community associations, entrepreneurs, SMEs, corporates and institutional clients) to realise their projects through solutions spanning financing, investment, savings and protection insurance. 
In Europe, the Group has four domestic markets (Belgium, France, Italy and Luxembourg) and BNP Paribas Personal Finance is the European leader in consumer lending.
BNP Paribas is rolling out its integrated retail-banking model in Mediterranean countries, in Turkey, in Eastern Europe and a large network in the western part of the United States. In its Corporate & Institutional Banking and Investment & Protection Services activities, BNP Paribas also enjoys top positions in Europe, a strong presence in the Americas as well as a solid and fast-growing business in Asia-Pacific.

To learn more about our social media terms and Data Protection Notice: https://group.bnpparibas/en/data-protection

The Schindler Group is a leading manufacturer and provider of related services for elevators, escalators, and moving walkways. 

Founded in 1874 in Switzerland, our company is at the forefront of industry innovation, working on pushing the boundaries of technological engineering, while having a strong focus on safety, comfort, efficiency and reliability. 

Moving more than two billion people each day, our products can be found in many well-known buildings throughout the globe, including office and residential buildings, airports, shopping centers/retail establishments and specialty buildings. 

We‚Äôre a leading employer in the industry, with over 69‚Äô000 engaged employees enabling mobility within the urban world. We have a network of over 1000 branch offices in over 100 countries, as well as production sites and research and development facilities in the US, Brazil, Europe, China and India.

At Schindler, our mission is to keep the world moving. 

We Elevate‚Ä¶ Our World

We‚Äôre a team of experts pushing the limits of what‚Äôs possible, united by our common goal to unlock true freedom through digital ownership, making technology accessible for all. We believe in a world where users, creators and enterprises manage their value with ownership and freedom. Our curiosity drives us to innovate, empowering individuals on a global scale. We believe change is constant and our team moves forward as one, with a culture of problem-solving where every employee is empowered and supported to challenge tradition and create solutions. Our mission is simple: to make self-custody accessible and give people the keys to their own financial futures. If you want to make a true impact, we want you to join us at Ledger.

At Ledger, we‚Äôre proud to be the global platform for digital assets and Web3, with over 20% of the world‚Äôs crypto assets secured through our Ledger devices. With our headquarters in Paris, and offices in Vierzon, Grenoble, Montpellier, London, Portland, Geneva, Zurich and Central Singapore, we have a team of around 600 professionals developing a variety of products and services to enable individuals and companies to securely buy, store, swap, grow and manage crypto assets ‚Äì including the Ledger hardware wallets line with more than 7.5 millions units already sold in 200 countries.

Internship duration: 6 months

The team

As a Coin Integration Intern, you‚Äôll join a team at the heart of Ledger‚Äôs mission: integrating and maintaining the blockchains that power our ecosystem.

The Coin Integration team ensures that Ledger devices and applications support a wide range of protocols, from Bitcoin to Solana, Polkadot, and Cosmos.

You‚Äôll work closely with experienced engineers to connect hardware, software, and decentralized networks, gaining hands-on experience with technologies shaping the future of Web3.

What You'll Be Doing

We are seeking a motivated and curious JavaScript/TypeScript developer to join our team for a 6-month internship. This is a unique opportunity to grow as a software engineer, learn how blockchain integrations are built and maintained, and contribute directly to Ledger‚Äôs products.- Contribute to blockchain integrations by helping integrate and maintain multiple protocols (EVM, Bitcoin, Solana, Polkadot, Cosmos, etc.) within the Ledger ecosystem.

  • Build and improve connectivity solutions that allow Ledger products to interact seamlessly with the broader Web3 ecosystem (Wallet API, Wallet Connect, Dapp integrations).
  • Develop your engineering skills through hands-on work in JavaScript and TypeScript, using frameworks such as Node.js and React, while applying clean code and modular design principles.
  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams, participating in agile ceremonies, code reviews, and cross-functional discussions to understand how software projects are delivered at scale.
  • Learn blockchain from the inside, discovering how various protocols operate and connect with hardware wallets ‚Äî no prior blockchain experience required, only curiosity.


What We're Looking For

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
  • Strong programming skills in JavaScript or TypeScript, with experience in Node.js or React (from coursework or personal projects).
  • Eagerness to learn about blockchain, Web3, and modern software practices.
  • Good communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.
  • Interest in software craftsmanship, writing maintainable, well-structured code and exploring functional programming concepts.
  • Familiarity with agile workflows and openness to feedback and iteration.


Benefits

At Ledger, we are dedicated to continually investing in our employees which is why we offer more than just salaries; we provide comprehensive compensation packages that include a wide range of benefits. Here are some of the benefits you can look forward to:

  • Social: Frequent social events, snacks and drinks
  • Transportation allowance: Ledger offers a commuter allowance to contribute to your preferred means of transportation.
  • Lunch vouchers: Ledger offers a meal allowance with Swile
  • Vacation: 1 day off for every full month of work, in addition to national holidays
  • Compensation: ‚Ç¨800 - ‚Ç¨1,500 a month


For regionally specific benefits, your Talent Acquisition contact will be able to provide you with more information.

We‚Äôre committed to building an inclusive hiring process. If you need any adjustments or accommodations, just let us know, we‚Äôll do our best to support you.
